16:12 <+lucaa> team, quick vote is XWIKI-6559 a bug or a feature?  
16:12 <+lucaa> (check the description, i detailed the cases and an inconsistency from this pov)  
16:14 <vmassol> not a bug but an improvement IMO  
16:15 <vmassol> I agree that we should have a url a param to force creation if the doc already exists  
16:15 <+lucaa> but it should be fixed, it's not a "feature" that we  should keep having  
16:15 <+lucaa> what would it mean force creation? delete existing and create a new one?  
16:15 <vmassol> overwrite I'd say  
16:15 <vmassol> like now I guess  
16:15 <+lucaa> (I didn't propose that, though...)  
16:16 <vmassol> ?force=true  
16:17 <vmassol> ah you're not talking about an action are you?  
16:17 <vmassol> (XWikiAction)  
16:18 <+lucaa> it is an XWikiAction in particular, now, but I don't see what that has to do with anything. I'm just asking if it's desired behaviour that we should keep or not. Please read down in the bug description my proposal about how to fix it

19:19 <chanikag> has left #xwiki  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Can you help me with some architecture questions?  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> I have an interface, which can be implemented by different classes  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> These classes need to access other components, so I'd like to use @Inject on some fields  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> At the same time, they need to be passed a certain value, ideally in their constructor  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> I also have a factory that can be used to instantiate them  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> So, I can see two options so far:  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> 1. Make them components, and add a package-private setter which can be used by the factory  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> 2. Make them simple classes (since they don't need to be components, the factory is the better way to instantiate them) and pass the required components in the constructor  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> Is 2 the right approach? Do you see any other options?  
19:28 <vmassol> 3 make the component per lookup and have a setter to set the fields  
19:28 <vmassol> (not saying it's better)  
19:28 <vmassol> (just listing all options)  
19:29 <vmassol> (3 removes the need for a factory)  
19:29 <vmassol> I don't know what's best, it depends what you need to set  
19:29 <@sdumitriu> I need the factory  
19:31 <vmassol> if you really need it then 2 sounds good  
19:31 <@sdumitriu> And I'd like the setter to be unaccessible to the outside code  
19:31 <@sdumitriu> It's similar to entity references  
19:31 <vmassol> just move the code in internal package  
19:31 <vmassol> if you want external code to access it  
19:31 <vmassol> s/want/don't want/  
19:31 <@sdumitriu> (it is internal already)  
19:31 <@sdumitriu> OK, thanks  
19:50 <vmassol> has quit
